rooms.description: A spacious entrance hall leading to the living area and kitchen, designed with Scandinavian minimalism. The entrance is oriented towards the north-west side for positive energy flow.
rooms.vastu_consideration: Entrance should be inviting and not aligned directly with the main door to avoid excessive ingress of negative energy.

rooms.description: A modern open-plan living room featuring neutral colors, natural lighting with large windows, and a connection to an adjoining terrace. The room is oriented for maximum light.
rooms.vastu_consideration: Living room should be in the center of the plan to promote balance.

rooms.description: An elegant dining area adjacent to the kitchen and living room. Scandinavian design emphasizes functionality with clean lines.
rooms.vastu_consideration: Dining area should be situated in a balanced position relative to the entrance.

rooms.description: A functional and modern kitchen with efficient workflow. Scandinavian minimalism is highlighted with integrated cabinetry.
rooms.vastu_consideration: The kitchen should face the east or north-east to enhance positive energy according to Vastu.

rooms.description: A guest bedroom designed with Scandinavian simplicity. A small study area is incorporated for work and leisure.
rooms.vastu_consideration: Rooms should be oriented in a balanced manner; this room faces north to maintain harmony.

rooms.description: A guest bathroom with Scandinavian fixtures and ample storage space.
rooms.vastu_consideration: Bathrooms are best placed in the north-west corner to avoid stagnant energy.

rooms.description: A dedicated private gym area with modern Scandinavian design. The space is equipped for various fitness activities.
rooms.vastu_consideration: The gym should be located away from the living areas to prevent disruption and maintain energetic balance.

openings.description: Main entrance door positioned on the north-west side, ensuring privacy while aligning with Vastu principles.
Large windows to maximize natural light in the living room and maintain Scandinavian aesthetics.
Sliding glass door connecting the dining area to the kitchen, promoting an open-plan layout.

rooms.description: A luxurious master bedroom with ample space, en-suite bathroom, and a balcony overlooking the scenic west-facing garden. Scandinavian design elements include minimalistic furniture.
rooms.vastu_consideration: Master bedroom should face the south or east for optimal rest and rejuvenation.

rooms.description: Additional master bedroom designed with Scandinavian style that emphasizes light and space.
rooms.vastu_consideration: Bedrooms should be oriented to avoid harsh sunlight; this room faces north-east.

rooms.description: A compact bedroom ensuring privacy with Scandinavian decor.
rooms.vastu_consideration: This room is oriented towards the west to balance energy.

rooms.description: A child's bedroom with Scandinavian design elements and a study area.
rooms.vastu_consideration: Child bedrooms should be in the north-east to encourage focus and positivity.

rooms.description: A guest or additional bedroom maintaining Scandinavian minimalism.
rooms.vastu_consideration: Positioned in a balanced area to ensure harmonious energy.

rooms.description: Bathrooms for the upper floor master and guest bedrooms. Scandinavian fixtures are integrated with modern design.
rooms.vastu_consideration: Bathrooms should be placed in the north-west or east to maintain Vastu principles.

openings.description: Staircase connecting ground floor and upper floor, with an open design for natural ventilation.
Balconies adjoining the master bedroom for scenic views of the west-facing garden.
Access point to the roof garden for relaxation and outdoor activities, designed with Scandinavian minimalism.
